shorttext.p: Mark and Adam have very kindly agreed to organise a boat party to celebrate Lin√≠s 20th birthday. There was a boat, there was music, there was drinking and there was dancing.
We got Ruby just a few days ago, bust she has already adjusted herself to the house very well. She also loves Al's place, where she can play at the well as long as she'd like.
Our family summer vacation at Mt. Tremblant, Canada. We stayed at the Fairmont Resort which is just below Saracusa in the heart of a European-style village and loved every minute of it!
Thanks so much everyone for coming to our party! Sue and me had a blast hosting everyone and you guys seemed to enjoy it a lot, too. Just have a look at the pictures ;)

entry.p: Hey there... how about we catch a movie tomorrow night? Say 8.30 PM at Glastino's? I'll get the tickets...

I'm doing soo much music these days, it's great - I have an Irish trio which is going well, paid gigs, etc, a rock band where we experiment and improvise, and now I've just started playing with a brilliant female jazz guitarist, doing the old jazz standards, grappelli-style. I still have my day job, but my main focus has been entirely packing in as much playing as possible. It's the thing I enjoy the most. How is your new album coming along?

The tour I'm organising is coming together, the Dutch band will be here from the 2nd to the 13th, shame you won't be around then. You could join us for some of the tour later, though. I'm meant to be hiring a van and driving them to all the gigs, what a mapcap idea in the middle of winter, but in for a penny, in for a pound ;)

You sound like you're having fun, we'd love to see you - and your new girl :) any time you're in Paris, you can bring me news of the outside world, going to the shops is a military operation these days, but I really appreciate it when I do get there!
Here is all fine. Martin's family finally arrived 2 weeks ago - it was an endless story trying to get the visa, the ticket money etc., but in the end we all got it!

How is life treating you? Hope you did well yesterday and enjoyed it as much as possible! Regarding your invitation to madrid: that sounds awesome and we would love to come. we just don't know yet, if we'll both get off 2 weeks at the same time in summer, but we'll definitely keep you posted.

Cheers for the fantastic email, we've been laughing out loud. It sure was better than 'On the Road' and 'Easy Rider' combined. I can't believe all the scrapes and adventures you've had, and you're still in one piece! What's up next?
How is it going? Let me know your plans around early October! Would be great to catch up, I think we will have fun and do a lot of nothing anyway ;)

As you know last year was a bit of a mess and I'm still trying to recover from the aftermath both financially and mentally. However, I am beyond any doubt planning to return to the heartland of Europe in May, so let's try and meet up soon!
Can you please send me your office number later today? For some reason your mobile seem to have been off for days - or did you flush it down the toilet again? ;)
The cashier at the supermarket is whistling. Now he's singing. I better not be in a musical.
My wife has a hangover and cramps and just told me she loves me. I think it's a trap.

The new house is great! Really enjoying having more space. Wishing I could snap my fingers and have it fully furnished, though... it's taking so long. Worst thing is figuring out the zillion window dressings - big disadvantage of this building.
A good way to test your knowledge of swear words is to discover you didn't properly close a can of paint when it falls over in your car.

Heard you ran into Denise today! I'm in the city for 2 more days and then we're heading to the cottage. Tomorrow, Darrah and her husband Brian are coming to have lunch with us. If you can join, that'd be great!

Dave and I always say we'd love to come back to camp for one summer: He'd like to teach tennis, and I'd just like to be a lady of leisure! Haha. Plus Fefe Dobson and Five for Fighting's Superman (my blue alma mater) were both just on the radio!
Only his big sister could bring me to tears on this beautiful, sunny day. It is a day to celebrate and the sun was shining just like today on the day he was born xoxo
The best part of eating cookies is the way they whimper when you bite them.
I am SO nostalgic for all things Spanish since last weekend. I have even been reading El Pais online everyday, don't ask me why ;)

Jimmy, are your reading this? There is a slim chance that I might be coming to Halifax for September long. We will all be chilling with some of Stevo's friends out of town for most of the trip. However, I would love love love to see you!
You come to a crossroads. There is a talking goat. Do not talk to the goat. The goat is a deceiver. The goat will tell you it is single.
Good luck to Dave with his move! We're anxious to see the new digs especially to compare with the "work in progress". With his style, I'm sure it will be totally amazing!
The best part of eating cookies is the way they whimper when you bite them.
I just moved all the stuffed animals in the room to face new directions. In case they were bored.

Fingers crossed for Canada Day weekend, but I'm thinking more like the middle of July. Have you walked by lately? Apparently the kitchen will take three weeks and then a week for the granite. My life is consumed by decision making these days.

I got the job here a week before we went to Europe. We've been here a month. I'm working at a social media agency and he's got a developing job! You'll have to come visit - bring Barry with you again too!!
Hates being sick... especially on a long weekend...
Why am I shopping for a car anyway? We're in the future. I should be shopping for a jetpack.
Would you come see me at Ochi Lounge at Comix on Saturday? Sure you would. You'd be a fool not to.
Sitting in Starbucks in Florida, listening to Vienna Tang - she sounds great!

Happy 30th Birthday to my beautiful sister!! You have always been so loving and supportive and I am so grateful that you are such a big part of my life. Here is to the next 30 being just as fabulous as the first :)
Dana Brown's surf documentary "High Water": likable doc, visually/rhythmically amazing, worth seeing even if you've never surfed in your life.
Hello New World. Just returned from my extended UK trip, 1st time on US soil in 2010... Nobody can understand me again, must pronounce consonants i guess.
Hillbilly Deluxe are a band from England I used to play with - We did part of the record there and doing overdubs here in the Ville!

Aunt Mitzy is so amazing, her mind doesn't miss a thing. She loved the flowers and there was a huge turn out at the party. It was nice to meet so many relatives who I've never met before and who all love Mitzy as much as I do.
To sum up: I dance badly. I dance badly *very well*.
Is finally putting her acting skills to the test - check out my few days of fame in the Studio In Essence commercial!

Productivity is important, but how can I be productive if I have this one little thing in my brain that I cannot get out. And that one little thing is a soft pretzel. So I√≠m just gonna have my soft pretzel. When I get back to work I√≠m gonna be super productive.
My mother used to say that average people are the most special people in the world, and that's why God made so many.
